ThingDef.label: bovine Beetle
ThingDef.description: This gigantic relative of the ladybug is one of the few creatures in the caverns worth keeping as livestock. Providing a conglomerate of different resources, from chitin when killed and honeydew when milked, and being quite easy to tame it is of considerable use to any cave dweller.

ThingDef.label: spider
ThingDef.description: These huge spiders are one of, if not the top, predator of the caverns. Living in holes within the walls of the cavern they lie in wait for prey to get close enough and they attack. They will wrap their prey in webbing to preserve them for later. Explorers beware getting too close to their den.

ThingDef.label: crystal Crab
ThingDef.description: Once a species of large land crab, this species has adapted to the cavern environment with large eyes and a crystal covered stone shell. From the moment they are born they are given a shell of hollowed out rock that their parents have chosen specially for the crystal that will continue to grow throughout their lives.

ThingDef.label: fruit bat
ThingDef.description: These flying mammals live deep in the caves and navigate via echolocation. Feeding off the Glowfruit of the caverns they can be a hassle to anyone that grows it.

ThingDef.label: giant snail
ThingDef.description: Their size, strength, and surprising speed allows them to be used as pack animals. When threatened they will retract inside of their shell in an attempt to prevent further harm.

ThingDef.label: jellypot bug
ThingDef.description: This comparatively small insect is a much desired livestock for any cave dwelling faction due to their hardiness and their ability to produce insect jelly over time.

ThingDef.label: lurelizard
ThingDef.description: This dark reptile inhabits the salty waters of caverns that border the sea. It uses its bioluminescent tail tip to lure its prey.

ThingDef.label: maxolotl
ThingDef.description: Giant relatives of the Axolotl, these salamanders have grown to huge proportions within the cavern environment they call home by eating and competing with the giant bugs that live within the caverns. While they are almost exclusively aquatic they can go onto land if need be.

ThingDef.label: mole
ThingDef.description: Moles roughly the size of a dog, These creatures can burrow through stone and soil with their incredibly strong claws which are often used as weapons by cave dwellers.

ThingDef.label: moss Beetle
ThingDef.description: This comparatively small beetle hides among the glowing moss within the cavern, attmpting to avoid detection

ThingDef.label: Pale Lizard
ThingDef.description: This small lizard has lost most of its color and has lost its eyes due to the adaptation to the cavern environment. It is a common prey animal for the carnivores of the caverns.

ThingDef.label: Pillbug
ThingDef.description: Roughly the size of a cow and with the temperment of one, these bugs have natural armor difficult for any predator to pierce through let alone the spikes that are on each segment that can impale foes.

ThingDef.label: royal rhino Beetle
ThingDef.description: Horned beetles almost the size of a muffalo. They get their names from the royal purple color of their chitinous shells. Predators or mating rivals beware their strong horns.

ThingDef.label: slime
ThingDef.description: A moving mass of goo, this bizarre creature is actually millions of microorganisms working in tandem. Due to the fact that its flesh is acidic they have virtually no natural predators. Their slime can be used to craft dangerous moats and can be used as a bio-fuel.

ThingDef.label: slug
ThingDef.description: This slimy mollusc has made these caverns home, the slime it secrets makes it taste terrible to humans but it is a common prey for the predators of the biome.

ThingDef.label: spectre Shrimp
ThingDef.description: Small and blind from adapting to the underground environment these arthropods are a considerable threat when they swarm, their sharp mouthparts slicing into soft prey with ease.

ThingDef.label: vampire bat
ThingDef.description: These flying mammals live deep in the caves and navigate via echolocation. Feeding off the blood of creature large enough they can be an easy vector for disease.

ThingDef.label: vampire moth
ThingDef.description: Deceptively cute and literally bloodthirsty, these giant moths will drink the blood of nearly any creature.
